intro: Notholaena eriophora, commonly known as the narrowleaf false larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Notholaena eriophora is adapted to arid environments and is known for its drought tolerance.
